title: When you see xerath doing damage higher than zoe in a match.

replies.body: Zoe’s damage is largely single target. Xerath is almost all AOE. They also have pretty similar dps all things considered.

> [{quoted}](name=EATARI,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=65Ej0M1b,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-05-11T04:10:56.468+0000)
>
> Zoe’s damage is largely single target. Xerath is almost all AOE. They also have pretty similar dps all things considered.

I'm not sure I would call Zoe's damage "largely" single target - a little over half of her kit's damage comes from Q, which is AoE.
It has a small splash effect after the initial strike of her q

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Apex,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=65Ej0M1b,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-11T04:19:34.911+0000)
>
> It has a small splash effect after the initial strike of her q

Yeah, that's AoE.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=65Ej0M1b,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-11T04:29:54.365+0000)
>
> Yeah, that's AoE.

Negligible compared to the giant Q of xerath and large radius W, plus decent R

> [{quoted}](name=Thaum1568,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=65Ej0M1b,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-11T05:14:56.014+0000)
>
> Negligible compared to the giant Q of xerath and large radius W, plus decent R

aoe is aoe brah. That's like saying a penis isn't a penis because it's too small.
